Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.ui

Interface PageOperator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PageOperatorImpl
    public interface PageOperator

    The PageOperator is used to handle pages. This includes the navigation or the data transmission between single pages. To get an instance use UI.getPageOperator().

    Note: This interfaces is still considered provisional. It is expected to evolve over the next releases, which may lead to slight changes. Consider using AbstractPage and it's methods.

    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    UI, Page
    No Implement:
    This interface is not intended to be implemented by clients.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void closeCurrentPage()
      Shows the last page and destroys the current active page.
      Page getCurrentPage()
      Returns the current visible Page object.
      PageData getCurrentPageData()
      Every page has it's own PageData.
      java.lang.String getCurrentPageId()
      Returns the current visible Page id.
      void openPage​(java.lang.String pageId)
      Opens a specific page on the client device.
      void openPage​(java.lang.String pageId, PageData data)
      Opens a specific page on the client device.
      void setCurrentPageTitle​(java.lang.String title)
      Sets the title for the defined page.

    • Method Detail

      • openPage

        void openPage​(java.lang.String pageId)
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Opens a specific page on the client device.

        Parameters:
        pageId - the Id of the page to open. Must not be empty or null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no page exist for the given id.
        Since:
        1.0

      • openPage

        void openPage​(java.lang.String pageId,
              PageData data)
       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Opens a specific page on the client device. The provided data will be the page data for the new page. See getCurrentPageData().

        Parameters:
        pageId - the Id of the page to show. Must not be empty or null.
        data - the page data for the new page. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when no page exist for the given id.
        Since:
        1.0

      • closeCurrentPage

        void closeCurrentPage()
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

        Shows the last page and destroys the current active page.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when it's called on a top level page.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getCurrentPage

        Page getCurrentPage()

        Returns the current visible Page object.

        Since:
        1.0

      • getCurrentPageData

        PageData getCurrentPageData()

        Every page has it's own PageData. You can influence this data by calling the openPage(String, PageData) method with a new PageData. This method returns the PageData for the current active page.

        Since:
        1.0

      • getCurrentPageId

        java.lang.String getCurrentPageId()

        Returns the current visible Page id.

        Since:
        1.2

      • setCurrentPageTitle

        void setCurrentPageTitle​(java.lang.String title)

        Sets the title for the defined page.

        Since:
        1.0
